bill_title: create a postsecondary education loan and scholarship program and to make an appropriation therefor.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to create a postsecondary education loan program. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby created the South Dakota first education loan program to provide postsecondary education loans for eligible students of state-supported universities who are South Dakota high school graduates. Section 2. Terms used in this Act mean: (1) "Board," the South Dakota first education loan program board of directors; (2) "Eligible student," any South Dakota high school graduate who: (a) Has graduated with a cumulative grade point average of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale; (b) Has completed a college preparatory curriculum that includes four years of English, four years of social science, three years of advanced mathematics beginning at the level of algebra and becoming progressively more difficult, three years of laboratory science, and at least one course in computer/information technology; (c) Has scored twenty-five or higher on the American College Testing examination, or its equivalent; (d) Has indicated an intent to live and work in South Dakota following postsecondary education; (e) Maintains satisfactory academic progress as determined by the board; (3) "Fund," the South Dakota first education loan program fund; (4) "Loan," a South Dakota first education loan pursuant to this Act; (5) "Program," the South Dakota first education loan program; (6) "South Dakota high school graduate," any graduate of a public or private high school in South Dakota, or a South Dakota resident who graduated from a high school in a neighboring state where the student had attended high school pursuant to a contract according to chapter 13-15, if the student graduated in the academic year immediately preceding the initial award of the loan; and (7) "Eligible institution," a public university under the control of the South Dakota Board of Regents. Section 3. There is hereby created in the state treasury the South Dakota first education loan program fund into which shall be deposited any appropriations, private donations, grants, and other funds provided to the board for loans pursuant to this Act. All revenues generated by loan repayments and any penalties received pursuant to this Act shall also be deposited in the fund. Expenditures from the fund shall be in the ratio of three general fund dollars to every two dollars from other sources. Section 4. There is hereby created the South Dakota first education loan fund board of directors. The board shall consist of four members appointed to four-year terms, two appointed by the Governor and two appointed by the Board of Regents. Not all members of the board may be of the same political party. The board shall oversee the fund and make loans to eligible students as funds are available based upon recommendations from one of the eligible institutions. Board members appointed by the Governor shall represent among them the interests of the state of South Dakota and private business in South Dakota. The board shall promulgate rules, pursuant to chapter 1-26, to govern its proceedings. Section 5. No loan made pursuant to this Act may exceed the cost of tuition and mandatory fees for a full-time student as defined by the Board of Regents. Section 6. The board shall promulgate rules, pursuant to chapter 1-26, to process loan applications, to determine a means of selecting eligible students to receive loans if applications exceed available money in the fund, and to govern satisfactory progress and conditions under which an eligible student may enroll at less than a full-time basis, including conditions under which a student may withdraw from an institution without penalty. Section 7. The board shall enter into a contract with each eligible student who qualifies for participation in the program according to the rules promulgated by the board. The written contract shall contain: (1) The terms and conditions under which the loan is made, and the requirements for repayment of the loan by the student; (2) A stipulation that no interest may be assessed on any loan through the program while the student is enrolled full-time, or enrolled part-time with approval of the board, and meets the eligibility requirements of the board; (3) The terms and conditions for qualifying for forgiveness of the loan principal and interest; (4) A provision that any financial obligations arising from the contract, and any obligations of the eligible student that are conditioned thereon, are contingent upon appropriations to the fund; and (5) The amount of the penalties assessed, if repayment of the loan by the student is not made in accordance with the contract, or the student fails to maintain eligibility or other requirements of the program. Section 8. An eligible student may participate in the program for up to ten semesters, whether consecutive or not. No student may participate in the program for more than seven years after commencing participation, whether consecutive or not. Any student who receives a loan and who fails to maintain satisfactory academic progress is ineligible for continued participation and is ineligible for forgiveness of any loan received. Section 9. An eligible student shall prepay the full value of the loan plus interest equivalent to the lowest rate assessed on federally guaranteed student loans at the time the loan reaches repayment, except as provided in section 10 of this Act. Any eligible student who fails to maintain satisfactory progress toward a degree as promulgated by the board shall repay the loan according to this section. Section 10. An eligible student who complies with the program requirements as promulgated by the board may qualify for forgiveness of a loan or loans received through the program. To qualify for loan forgiveness, an eligible student who has received a South Dakota first education loan and who has graduated shall satisfy one of the following: (1) For each year following graduation from an eligible institution that the student lives and works in South Dakota, one tenth of the loan principal balance and its interest is forgiven; (2) For each year following graduation from an eligible institution that the student lives and works outside of South Dakota for a South Dakota company with its corporate offices in South Dakota, or a company with a substantial presence in South Dakota as defined by the board of directors, one tenth of the loan principal balance and its interest is forgiven; and (3) For each year following graduation from an eligible institution that the student is a member of the armed services or a participant in a federal service program such as Volunteers in Service to America (VISTA) or the Peace Corps, or their successor organizations, as approved by the board of directors, the loan repayment and interest shall be deferred until such time as the obligation to the federal government is complete.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to create a postsecondary education loan program and to make an appropriation therefor. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby created the South Dakota first education loan program to provide postsecondary education loans for eligible students of state-supported universities who are South Dakota high school graduates. Section 2. Terms used in this Act mean: (1) "Board," the South Dakota Board of Regents; (2) "Eligible student," any South Dakota high school graduate who: (a) Has graduated with a cumulative grade point average of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale; (b) Has completed a college preparatory curriculum that includes four years of English, four years of social science, three years of advanced mathematics beginning at the level of algebra and becoming progressively more difficult, three years of laboratory science, and at least one course in computer/information technology; (c) Has scored twenty-five or higher on the American College Testing examination, or its equivalent; (d) Has indicated an intent to live and work in South Dakota following postsecondary education; (e) Maintains satisfactory academic progress as determined by the board; (3) "Fund," the South Dakota first education loan program fund; (4) "Loan," a South Dakota first education loan pursuant to this Act; (5) "Program," the South Dakota first education loan program; (6) "South Dakota high school graduate," any graduate of a public or private high school in South Dakota, or a South Dakota resident who graduated from a high school in a neighboring state where the student had attended high school pursuant to a contract according to chapter 13-15, if the student graduated in the academic year immediately preceding the initial award of the loan; and (7) "Eligible institution," a public university under the control of the South Dakota Board of Regents. Section 3. There is hereby created in the state treasury the South Dakota first education loan program fund into which shall be deposited any appropriations, private donations, grants, and other funds provided to the board for loans pursuant to this Act. All revenues generated by loan repayments and any penalties received pursuant to this Act shall also be deposited in the fund. Expenditures from the fund shall be in the ratio of three general fund dollars to every two dollars from other sources. Section 4. The Board of Regents shall oversee the fund created in this Act and make loans to eligible students as funds are available based upon recommendations from one of the eligible institutions. Section 5. No loan made pursuant to this Act may exceed the cost of tuition and mandatory fees for a full-time student as defined by the Board of Regents. Section 6. The Board of Regents shall promulgate rules, pursuant to chapter 1-26, to process loan applications, to determine a means of selecting eligible students to receive loans if applications exceed available money in the fund, and to govern satisfactory progress and conditions under which an eligible student may enroll at less than a full-time basis, including conditions under which a student may withdraw from an institution without penalty. Section 7. Any student selected for a loan pursuant to this Act shall sign a contract agreeing to comply with the rules promulgated by the board. The written contract shall contain: (1) The terms and conditions under which the loan is made, and the requirements for repayment of the loan by the student; (2) A stipulation that no interest may be assessed on any loan through the program while the student is enrolled full-time, or enrolled part-time with approval of the board, and meets the eligibility requirements of the board; (3) The terms and conditions for qualifying for forgiveness of the loan principal and interest; (4) A provision that any financial obligations arising from the contract, and any obligations of the eligible student that are conditioned thereon, are contingent upon appropriations to the fund; and (5) The amount of the penalties assessed, if repayment of the loan by the student is not made in accordance with the contract, or the student fails to maintain eligibility or other requirements of the program. Section 8. An eligible student may participate in the program for up to ten semesters, whether consecutive or not. No student may participate in the program for more than seven years after commencing participation, whether consecutive or not. Any student who receives a loan and who fails to maintain satisfactory academic progress is ineligible for continued participation and is ineligible for forgiveness of any loan received. Section 9. An eligible student shall repay the full value of the loan plus interest equivalent to the lowest rate assessed on federally guaranteed student loans at the time the loan reaches repayment, except as provided in section 10 of this Act. Any eligible student who fails to maintain satisfactory progress toward a degree as promulgated by the board shall repay the loan according to this section. Section 10. An eligible student who complies with the program requirements as promulgated by the board may qualify for forgiveness of a loan or loans received through the program. To qualify for loan forgiveness, an eligible student who has received a South Dakota first education loan and who has graduated shall satisfy one of the following: (1) For each year following graduation from an eligible institution that the student lives and works in South Dakota, one tenth of the loan principal balance and its interest is forgiven; (2) For each year following graduation from an eligible institution that the student lives and works outside of South Dakota for a South Dakota company with its corporate offices in South Dakota, or a company with a substantial presence in South Dakota as defined by the board, one tenth of the loan principal balance and its interest is forgiven; (3) For each year following graduation from an eligible institution that the student is a member of the armed services or a participant in a federal service program such as Volunteers in Service to America (VISTA) or the Peace Corps, or their successor organizations, as approved by the board, one-tenth of the loan principal balance and its interest is forgiven; and (4) For each year following graduation from an eligible institution that the student lives and works in South Dakota, even if the student has lived and worked outside of South Dakota for a time and then returned to South Dakota to establish permanent residence, one-tenth of the loan principal balance and its interest is forgiven. Section 11. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund the sum of two hundred four thousand dollars ($204,000), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Board of Regents for deposit in the South Dakota first education loan program fund to make loans pursuant to this Act. Section 12. There is hereby appropriated the sum of one hundred thirty-six thousand dollars ($136,000) of other fund expenditure authority to the Board of Regents to make loans pursuant to this Act. Section 13. The Board of Regents shall annually determine, based upon each university's percentage share of the most recent system total of full-time equivalent student fall enrollment, the total amount of loans which may be allocated to each eligible institution. If an eligible institution does not participate in the program, its share of the amount available for loans shall be redistributed to the participating eligible institutions. Section 14. The executive director of the Board of Regents shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 15. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 2000, shall revert in accordance with § 4-8-21. Section 16. The Board of Regents shall annually provide the state treasurer a report indicating the recipients of loans pursuant to this Act, and copies of contracts. Section 17. The state treasurer shall promulgate rules, pursuant to chapter 1-26, to establish: procedures for notifying contract violators; collection procedures; forgiveness or deferment procedures and special circumstances; and repayment schedules. Section 18. The state treasurer is directed to transfer to the state general fund the sum of two hundred four thousand dollars ($204,000) from the private activity bond fees fund, created in § 1-7-10, for the purposes of this Act. BILL HISTORY 1/27/99 First read in House and referred to committee assignment waived. H.J. 216 1/28/99 Referred to State Affairs. H.J. 240 2/1/99 House of Representatives Referred to Appropriations. 2/12/99 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/12/99 Appropriations Deferred to another day. 2/17/99 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/18/99 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/18/99 Appropriations Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 9, NAYS 0. H.J. 594

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to create a postsecondary education loan program and to make an appropriation therefor. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Section 2. Terms used in this Act mean: (1) "Board," the South Dakota Board of Regents; (2) "Eligible student," any South Dakota high school graduate who: (a) Has graduated with a cumulative grade point average of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale; (b) Has completed a college preparatory curriculum that includes four years of English, four years of social science, three years of advanced mathematics beginning at the level of algebra and becoming progressively more difficult, three years of laboratory science, and at least one course in computer/information technology; (c) Has scored twenty-five or higher on the American College Testing examination, or its equivalent; (d) Has indicated an intent to live and work in South Dakota following postsecondary education; (e) Maintains satisfactory academic progress as determined by the board; (3) "Fund," the South Dakota first education loan program fund; (4) "Loan," a South Dakota first education loan pursuant to this Act; (5) "Program," the South Dakota first education loan program; (6) "South Dakota high school graduate," any graduate of a public or private high school in South Dakota, or a South Dakota resident who graduated from a high school in a neighboring state where the student had attended high school pursuant to a contract according to chapter 13-15, if the student graduated in the academic year immediately preceding the initial award of the loan; and (7) "Eligible institution," a public university under the control of the South Dakota Board of Regents. FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to create a postsecondary education loan and scholarship program and to make an appropriation therefor. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby created the South Dakota education loan and scholarship program to provide postsecondary education loans and scholarships for eligible students of institutions of higher education located in South Dakota who are South Dakota high school graduates. Section 2. Terms used in this Act mean: (1) "Board," the South Dakota Board of Regents; (2) "Eligible student," any South Dakota high school graduate who is a full-time student at an eligible institution; (3) "Fund," the South Dakota education loan and scholarship program fund; (5) "Program," the South Dakota education loan and scholarship program; (6) "South Dakota high school graduate," any graduate of a public or private high school in South Dakota, or a South Dakota resident who graduated from a high school in a neighboring state where the student had attended high school pursuant to a contract according to chapter 13-15, if the student graduated in the academic year immediately preceding the initial award of the loan; and (7) "Eligible institution," any accredited institution of higher education located in South Dakota. Section 3. There is hereby created in the state treasury the South Dakota education loan and scholarship program fund into which shall be deposited any appropriations, private donations, grants, and other funds provided to the board for loans and scholarships pursuant to this Act. All revenues generated by loan repayments and any penalties received pursuant to this Act shall also be deposited in the fund. Expenditures from the fund shall be in the ratio of one general fund dollar to every four dollars from other sources. Section 4. The Board of Regents shall oversee the fund created in this Act and make loans and scholarships to eligible students as funds are available based upon recommendations from one of the eligible institutions. Section 5. No loan or scholarship made pursuant to this Act may exceed the cost of tuition and mandatory fees for a full-time student as defined by the Board of Regents. Section 6. The Board of Regents shall promulgate rules, pursuant to chapter 1-26, to process loan and scholarship applications, to determine a means of selecting eligible students to receive loans and scholarships if applications exceed available money in the fund, and to govern satisfactory progress and conditions under which an eligible student may enroll at less than a full- time basis, including conditions under which a student may withdraw from an institution without penalty. Section 7. Any student selected for a loan or scholarship pursuant to this Act shall sign a contract agreeing to comply with the rules promulgated by the board. Section 8. An eligible student may participate in the program for up to eight semesters, whether consecutive or not. No student may participate in the program for more than seven years after commencing participation, whether consecutive or not. Any student who receives a loan or scholarship and who fails to maintain satisfactory academic progress is ineligible for continued participation and is ineligible for forgiveness of any loan received. Section 9. The board may establish program requirements which allow eligible students to qualify for forgiveness of a loan or loans received through the program. Section 10. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund the sum of two hundred four thousand dollars ($204,000), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Board of Regents for deposit in the South Dakota education loan and scholarship program fund to make loans and scholarships pursuant to this Act. Section 11. There is hereby appropriated the sum of eight hundred sixteen thousand dollars ($816,000) of other fund expenditure authority to the Board of Regents to make loans pursuant to this Act. Section 12. The Board of Regents shall annually determine, based upon each institution's percentage share of the most recent statewide total of full-time equivalent student fall enrollment of South Dakota residents, the total amount of loans and scholarships which may be allocated to each eligible institution. If an eligible institution does not participate in the program, its share of the amount available for loans and scholarships shall be redistributed to the participating eligible institutions. Section 13. The executive director of the Board of Regents shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 14. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 2000, shall revert in accordance with § 4-8-21. Section 15. The Board of Regents shall annually provide the state treasurer a report indicating the recipients of loans and scholarships pursuant to this Act, and copies of contracts. Section 16. The state treasurer is directed to transfer to the state general fund the sum of two hundred four thousand dollars ($204,000) from the private activity bond fees fund, created in § 1-7-10, for the purposes of this Act. BILL HISTORY 1/27/99 First read in House and referred to State Affairs. H.J. 216 1/28/99 Referred to State Affairs. H.J. 240 2/1/99 House of Representatives Referred to Appropriations.
